Articles.Content:
First, I like the new wysiwyg editor, and love that it remembers where you left off off if you don't post your reply, but can we get a button to clear it? If you quote a message, it's fiddly to clear it on the desktop editor, and impossible on the mobile one!

A simple "clear" button would resolve this.on that subject, on the mobile forum the cursor jumps to the end of the last text you typed, even if you manually move it to a new line. (hence the bad formatting on this post) if you quote a message, you type in the quote box and can't move it out. Also, the forum keeps notifying me of a message from 6 months ago, even though I read it multiple times

We currently have a push to get a toggle for the WYSIWYG editor that lets you switch over to seeing the BBcode if you want to (entirely optional). Clearing it out then is then as simple as holding down backspace/delete.

To clear the editor, use the mouse to click inside it to focus it, then use control+a to select all, then use the "cut" button or the del or backspace keys to remove all content.

This will also remove quotes, to only clear the contents of a quote, click inside it and use the above key strokes.
That works fine on desktop (but is fiddly as I said) but doesn't help phones. Select all stops the box registering as input and the keyboard disappears. (Firefox android)
